info.title: FHIR Patient resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns Patients based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Patient.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Whether the patient record is active

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: An address in any kind of address/part of the patient

parameters.name: address-city
parameters.description: A city specified in an address

parameters.name: address-country
parameters.description: A country specified in an address

parameters.name: address-postalcode
parameters.description: A postalCode specified in an address

parameters.name: address-state
parameters.description: A state specified in an address

parameters.name: address-use
parameters.description: A use code specified in an address

parameters.name: animal-breed
parameters.description: The breed for animal patients

parameters.name: animal-species
parameters.description: The species for animal patients

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: The patient's date of birth. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: careprovider
parameters.description: Patient's nominated care provider, could be a care manager, not the organization that manages the record

parameters.name: death-date
parameters.description: The date of death has been provided and satisfies this search value. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: deceased
parameters.description: This patient has been marked as deceased, or as a death date entered

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A value in an email contact

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: A portion of the family name of the patient

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Gender of the patient

parameters.name: given
parameters.description: A portion of the given name of the patient

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A patient identifier

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language code (irrespective of use value)

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: All patients linked to the given patient

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A portion of either family or given name of the patient

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The organization at which this person is a patient

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: A value in a phone contact

parameters.name: phonetic
parameters.description: A portion of either family or given name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

parameters.name: telecom
parameters.description: The value in any kind of telecom details of the patient

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing Patient based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of Patients based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.

FHIR documentation for Patient.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date of care dates range. All records relating to care provided in a given date range will be returned. If no date is provided, all records are in scope.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date of care dates range. All records relating to care provided in a given date range will be returned. If no date is provided, all records are in scope.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

200.description: Return all the information related to patient described in the resource on which this operation is invoked.
